ygData.messageBody:
On Tue, 8 Jun 1999, Mott, Mike J. wrote:
>
> I did some experimentation with invisibility last night at
> the big monolith on the shore in North Karana. It seems
> that with the song, I am also invisible to undead (
> zombies and skellies). Of course if you have an unlucky
> moment and become visible, then they all attack.

I found the same thing. Ice bones, elf skeletons, ghouls,
etc. would ignore me (were indifferent to me) with the song
going.

> I remember reading that invisibility did not work for
> undead. Was this only for the mana user's version, or do
> higher lvl undead's see right through it?

Bear in mind the justification for the bard's invisibility is
"a soft mist surrounds you." So the way I figure it, our
invisibility is not the same as the invisibility spell
("Soandso fades away"). So perhaps the difference with undead
is intentional. It would also explain why we have a big
glowing ball of light to give away our position (although it
would be nice if the ball stayed there all the time to
facilitate group travel).

Many animals seem to be able to see right through the mist
though; at least their /con message did not change with the
song.
